revision.text:
{{Use mdy dates|date=July 2017}} {{BLP sources|date=March 2013}} {{Infobox person | name = Janet Varney | image = Janet Varney Oct 2014 (cropped).jpg | alt = | caption = Varney at the Comic Media Expo in October 2014 | birth_name = Janet Maureen Varney | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1976|02|16}} | birth_place = [[Tucson, Arizona]], U.S. | death_date = | death_place = | nationality = American | education = [[Rincon High School]] | alma_mater = [[San Francisco State University]] | occupation = Actress | years_active = 2003–present | website = {{URL|http://janetvarney.com/}} }} '''Janet Maureen Varney''' (born February 16, 1976) is an American actress. She voiced [[Korra (The Legend of Korra)|Korra]] in the [[Nickelodeon]] animated television series ''[[The Legend of Korra]]''. ==Early life== Varney was born and raised in [[Tucson, Arizona]]. She graduated as [[salutatorian]] from [[Rincon High School]] in 1993{{cite web|url=http://tucson.com/news/local/justice-keeps-listeners-posted-on-heart-surgery/article_984c83a3-d9cb-597a-bb88-868593ef06db.html|title=Justice keeps listeners posted on heart surgery|first=Phil Villarreal Arizona Daily|last=Star|publisher=}}''The JV Club'' #153: Felicia Day http://nerdist.com/the-jv-club-153-felicia-day/ and is an alumna of [[San Francisco State University]] where she majored in theater. She later pursued a career in interior design before eventually finding her way back into acting.Conversations With Ross: Featuring Janet Varney http://www.rosscarey.com/2012/08/22/episode-69-janet-varney/ Varney was raised [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints|Mormon]], but left the church at 17 and now identifies as an [[Agnosticism|agnostic]].''The JV Club'' #29: Cara Santa Maria http://nerdist.com/the-jv-club-29-cara-santa-maria/ Varney is of English and Scottish descent.{{cite web|url=http://www.ancestry.com/name-origin?surname=varney|title=Varney Family History|work=[[Ancestry.com]]|accessdate=May 11, 2015}} ==Career== ===Television projects=== Varney was co-host of The Hollywood Show with [[Brian Unger]], a recurring player on [[Norm Macdonald]]'s sketch show ''Back to Norm'' and an ensemble player on [[Crossballs]], all for [[Comedy Central]]. She also starred in the short-lived [[Fox Broadcasting Company|FOX]] comedy [[Happy Hour (TV Series)|''Happy Hour'']]. In 2007, Varney appeared in the short films ''Random Acts of Kindness'', ''Die Hardly Working'', ''Eternal Waters'', ''Worldly Possession'', ''The Losers'', ''Keep Off Grass'', and ''Dress For Success'' which were made during the reality show ''[[On the Lot]]''. She has recently appeared as recurring character "Bev" for the web series ''Back on Topps'' with [[Randy and Jason Sklar]]. Starting in 2008, she began starring in the [[HBO]] television series [[Entourage (U.S. TV series)|''Entourage'']], playing television producer Amy Miller who works alongside [[Eric Murphy|Eric]] and [[Bow Wow (rapper)|Charlie]]. Varney was also cast in a movie called ''Best Player'', starring opposite Jerry Trainor and Jennette McCurdy. As well as television, Varney acts as host on ''[https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL7atuZxmT957_N4O2Jp3bMXmq_Y7J-mK- ESCAPE!]'', a web series broadcast on [[Geek & Sundry]] where teams of celebrities work together to get out of an [[escape room]].{{cite web|url=http://geekandsundry.com/introducing-escape-with-janet-varney-geek-and-sundrys-new-escape-room-show/|title=''Introducing ESCAPE! with Janet Varney''|work=Geek & Sundry|accessdate=March 30, 2017}} ===''Dinner and a Movie''=== In 2005, Varney replaced [[Lisa Kushell]] as the host of the TBS cooking and entertainment show, ''[[Dinner and a Movie]]''. She appeared with [[Paul Gilmartin]] and Claud Mann in each episode, introducing films and injecting humor during the preparation of a creative dinner for some themes. The series was cancelled in 2011. ===Rifftrax=== Varney has written and performed several comedic audio commentaries for films along with fellow SF Sketchfest co-founder [[Cole Stratton]]. These appear on the [[Rifftrax]] website under the ''Rifftrax Presents'' branding, as being officially sanctioned by Rifftrax founder and ''[[Mystery Science Theater 3000]]'' alumnus, [[Michael J. Nelson]]. She has performed in Rifftrax commentaries for the following films: *''[[Footloose (1984 film)|Footloose]]'' *''[[Poltergeist (film)|Poltergeist]]'' *''[[Ghost (1990 film)|Ghost]]'' *''[[Dirty Dancing]]'' *''[[Jaws 3-D]]'' *''[[Flatliners]]'' *''[[The Lost Boys]]'' *''[[Dreamscape (1984 film)|Dreamscape]]'' ===Other professional projects=== Varney is the co-founder, creative director and producer of [[SF Sketchfest]], The San Francisco Comedy Festival and is also the co-founder of the San Francisco sketch group Totally False People. She performed with the [[Los Angeles]] and [[San Francisco]]-based group Sequel 4000. In March 2012, she launched a podcast entitled ''The JV Club'', hosted on [[Nerdist Industries|Nerdist.com]].{{cite web|url=http://www.nerdist.com/podcast/the-jv-club/|title=''The JV Club''|work=Nerdist|accessdate=October 30, 2014}} Varney participated on a regular basis on the improv comedy podcast [[Spontaneanation]] with [[Paul F. Tompkins]], where she is referred to as "Little Janet" Varney. ==Personal life== She was in a relationship with comedian [[Chris Hardwick]] from 2004 to 2011.{{cite news|url=http://laist.com/2009/06/30/chris_hardwick.php|title=Chris Hardwick: Nerdism For Fun and Profit|date=June 30, 2009|work=[[Gothamist]]|accessdate=April 13, 2011|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20170719044120/http://laist.com/2009/06/30/chris_hardwick.php|archivedate=July 19, 2017|df=mdy-all}} In young adulthood, Varney was diagnosed with [[depersonalization disorder]].''The Mental Illness Happy Hour'' Episode 1: Janet Varney http://mentalpod.com/podcast-janet-varney In 2018, Varney came out as bisexual on her Instagram page telling a listener “You should listen to my podcast, I’ve made no secret of my bisexuality.”https://www.instagram.com/p/Bkk_ihUnStY/?utm_source=ig_share_sheet&igshid=1nlqf3gqq9x31 ==Filmography== [[File:Janet Varney by Gage Skidmore.jpg|thumb|Varney at the 2012 [[San Diego Comic-Con International]]]] ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role !
